TopicTitle: If Eve would be considered a class Y planet...

Articles.Content:
Hey guys, I just realized - In ST-VOY, Voyager takes off of a Demon class, or class Y world. Basically, conditions similar to Eve.

Does this mean that the USS Voyager is an Eve SSTO capable ship?

Okay that's all I had to say. Bye.
They have magic reactionless drives in Star Trek, so it doesn't count.

They have magic reactionless drives in Star Trek, so it doesn't count.

Shhh

Ignore that.
Voyager is a SSTHWATG - Single Stage To Half Way Across The Galaxy...

I don't know about that, but I'll tell you this: I do not want biomimetic lifeforms making clones of my Kerbals.

Voyager was built in an orbital drydock at Mars anyway. Though she did land and go back to space a few times...
Voyager used unbalanced mods, it doesnt count.

Voyager used unbalanced mods, it doesnt count.

Not to mention it requires the debug menu to fly.

Not to mention it requires the debug menu to fly.

You forgot that no one learned how to fly giant spacecraft, so MechJeb had to be used to move it distances more than 1cm.

Not to mention it requires the debug menu to fly.

Part clipping's off, Infinite fuel is off, Infinite RCS is off, Infinite EVA is off, and Both stop-breakages/exploding ones are off.

Hack gravity would stop it going into orbit.

You forgot that no one learned how to fly giant spacecraft, so MechJeb had to be used to move it distances more than 1cm.

Tom Paris is offended.

Tom Paris is offended.

Isn't it a shame that the controls just input everything to MechJeb?
No they don't. While they have warp drives, the Impulse Drive is NOT a reactionless drive. It's a fusion rocket.
